discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Both B and D would enable Intrusion protection. However, D is the best answer because the question states that the building is historic and adding APs is difficult. Therefore you would not want to switch existing client serving local access points to monitor mode as this would create coverage holes not easily filled by adding coverage. D keeps the access point client serving as well as implementing intrusion protection.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct
B is correct

Selected Answer: D
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/technology/wips/deployment/guide/WiPS_deployment_guide.html
On-Channel vs. Off-Channel Scanning per wIPS Mode
The figure below explains the radio’s behavior. When a radio is on its serving channel it is considered “on-channel”, when the radio is scanning other channels, it is considered “off-channel”.

An AP in local mode is mostly “on-channel”, making it difficult to detect attackers “off-channel”. A monitor mode AP is always “off-channel”, but cannot server clients, the WSM module provides a great combination of both.
B is coreect
correct, the on-channel says no need to scan other channels.
provided answer is correct

questions.question_text: An engineer must implement intrusion protection on the WLAN. The AP coverage is adequate and on-channel attacks are the primary concern. The building is historic, which makes adding APs difficult. Which AP mode and submode must be implemented?

choices.C: AP mode: monitor, AP submode: none
choices.A: AP mode: local, AP submode: none
choices.D: AP mode: local, AP submode: WIPS
choices.B: AP mode: monitor, AP submode: WIPS

questions.question_text: A network engineer is deploying 8865 IP phones with wireless clients connected to them. In order to apply the appropriate QoS, the IP voice traffic needs to be distinguished from client data traffic. Which switch configuration feature must be enabled?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
To distinguish IP voice traffic from client data traffic and apply the appropriate QoS, the Voice VLAN feature must be enabled on the switch. Here’s why:

Voice VLAN:
This feature allows the switch to separate voice traffic (from devices like IP phones) from data traffic (from connected wireless clients). By assigning the IP phone to a dedicated Voice VLAN, the switch can prioritize voice traffic using QoS policies, ensuring high-quality voice communication.

How it works:
The IP phone is connected to the switch, and wireless clients may connect through the phone. The switch tags voice traffic with the Voice VLAN ID and applies QoS policies to prioritize it, while data traffic is handled separately.

Selected Answer: A
A Voice VLAN is specifically designed to separate voice traffic from data traffic on the network. By configuring a Voice VLAN, the switch can prioritize IP voice traffic (e.g., from the 8865 IP phones) and apply the appropriate QoS settings to ensure high-quality voice communication.
Provided answer is correct

Selected Answer: B
Cisco FlexConnect Central Assoc.: This feature ensures that FlexConnect APs associate centrally with the WLC for key management and other centralized functions. Enabling this allows CKM to work properly for FlexConnect APs during roaming.

Why not the other options?
A. Configure VLAN-based central switching: This is unrelated to CKM and focuses on traffic forwarding.

C. Use local authentication: This is not required for CKM to function with FlexConnect APs.

D. Place APs in a Cisco FlexConnect group: While grouping APs is useful for management, it does not directly resolve the CKM issue.

Thus, the correct action is to enable Cisco FlexConnect Central Assoc. to ensure CKM works for FlexConnect APs.

Selected Answer: D
FlexConnect groups are responsible for sharing services
between APs in the group. For example, the following services
are shared within a FlexConnect group:
Cisco Centralized Key Management (CCKM) / Opportunistic Key
Caching (OKC) fast roaming keys
Local/backup RADIUS server keys
Local EAP (Extensible Authentication Protocol) authentication
Smart Image upgrade
FlexConnect AVC (Application Visibility and Control)
AAA-Override for local switching

Selected Answer: D
D. is correct

questions.question_text: An engineer enabled Cisco Centralized Key Management (CKM) on a WLAN with local and FlexConnect mode APs. The engineer notices that Cisco CKM is not working for the FlexConnect APs when looking at roaming, but it works for local mode APs. Which change must be made on the controller for the configuration to work properly?

choices.D: Place APs in a Cisco FlexConnect group.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
If the lightweight access point (AP) is joined to a Wireless LAN Controller (WLC) that does not have specific AP credentials defined, the engineer should use:

D. AP Global Configuration configured credentials.

These credentials are configured as part of the global settings for the access point on the WLC and will be used for logging in to access the AP directly. If global credentials are not defined, the AP will not have a defined way to authenticate access requests directly.

Selected Answer: D
tested in lab with 1832i AP. Once the AP associated to WLC. it will sync config / setting with WLC. actually, when a AP associated to WLC. SUPPOES no need to login ap induvial. we can manage the APs via WLC. we have to setup the AP login via AP global config. 

A & B are wrong. tested 2-3 model , default login is Cisco/cisco.

Looks like D is better
Option B (Cisco/Cisco) is not the correct answer because it is a common default username and password combination that is typically used for initial setup or testing purposes. However, in a production environment, it is recommended to use more secure and unique credentials.

Lab Exercise (9800-CL, 17.3.7):
ssh disbaled by default // telnet disbaled by default
set to enable leads to the following error message
"Error in Configuring AP JOIN PROFILE - AP SSH access enable config is not allowed with AP user management credentials set to default"

Selected Answer: D
Lab Test with (9800-CL, 17.3.7)

Selected Answer: D
correct is D Ap joined the WLC.

questions.question_text: An engineer is trying to log in to their lightweight access point joined to a WLC that does not have AP credentials defined. Which credentials does the engineer use?

A network engineer is configuring a Cisco AireOS 8.2 WLC, Cisco MSE, and Cisco PI with Cisco 3700 Series APs and Cisco Hyperlocation modules. The engineer configures and enables a WLAN with Hyperlocation. During testing, the engineer notices that the Hyperlocation module cannot be seen on the WLC. Which action resolves the issue?

choices.B: Enable Hyperlocation in the Global Configuration settings of the WLC.
choices.A: Configure the APs to be in monitor mode.
choices.C: Add the key hash that is used to add the Hyperlocation module to the WLC.
choices.D: Enable the NTP server that is connected to the Hyperlocation module.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
HyperLocation module cannot be seen on the WLC

 Ensure the correct AP type is used for deployment.

 Ensure the correct software code is installed for the WLC that supports the HyperLocation module deployment.

 Ensure HyperLocation is enabled on the WLC global configuration settings.

 Ensure HyperLocation Module is plugged in right and screws are tight.

 Ensure that the AP is not in monitor mode.

 Ensure the correct recommended bracket (AIR-AP-BRACKET-2) is used to install the AP and Module combination.

More source
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-2/b_hyperLocation_best_practices_and_troubleshooting_guide.html#id_12821

Selected Answer: B
Step 1 
Choose Wireless > Access Points > Global Configuration.

Step 2 
In the Hyperlocation Config Parameters section:

Check the Enable Hyperlocation check box.

Based on AP and installed module, checking the Enable Hyperlocation check box enables different location service (PRL-based or AoA-based).
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/8-2/config-guide/b_cg82/b_cg82_chapter_011010.html#config-hyperlocation-global:~:text=Check%20the%20Enable%20Hyperlocation%20check%20box.

Selected Answer: B
Correct answer should be B. Wireless --> Access Points --> Global Configuration --> Enable Hyperlocation checkbox.
